definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Have Siti's parents fulfilled their responsibilities to protect her?
sentences.chinese: 西蒂的父母尽到保护女儿的责任了吗？

definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
at fault/blamed for/responsible (for a blunder or crime)
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
